title: POLARIS and DLR to Explore Integrating Spaceplanes in Commercial Airspace
summary: The German space agency DLR has signed an agreement with POLARIS Spaceplanes to explore how to integrate regular spaceplane and hypersonic vehicle flights into commercial airspace. Founded in 2019, Bremen-based POLARIS Spaceplanes is developing a multipurpose spaceplane and hypersonic transport system. The company’s vehicles utilize jet engines during take-off, landing, and pre-ignition phases of flight, […]

title: China launches first satellites for Thousand Sails megaconstellation
summary: PRESTON, United Kingdom — China successfully launched the first batch of 18 satellites Tuesday for the Thousand Sails low Earth orbit communications megaconstellation. A Long March 6A rocket lifted off […]

title: NASA budget pressures create opportunities for smallsats
summary: Tight budgets for NASA could provide new opportunities for smallsats that have increasingly demonstrated their capability to perform low-cost science missions.

title: Rosetta and beyond: tales of a mission that left a mark
summary: Exactly ten years on since Rosetta arrived at Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko, we dig into how the intrepid explorer has transformed our knowledge of comets, revealed some crucial pieces in the Solar System jigsaw puzzle, and shaped how we develop new missions.
